title: Personalized Adaptive Gamification Learning System Design and Practice: Enhancing Social Interaction and Civic Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge and extensive practical experience in the field, foundational understanding of social interaction and civic education
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning and AI-driven real-time feedback in BYOD environments: Building social learning networks to facilitate knowledge sharing, with case studies applying project-based learning for community problem-solving.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze a provided learner profile dataset to apply three+ personalization algorithms in designing an AI-based content recommendation system, incorporate collaborative learning enhancement strategies via social network analysis into a prototype design document, and submit it within a week.
Developing learning motivation strategies with gamification mechanisms: designing reward systems reflecting cultural/historical contexts and activities to encourage civic engagement.

Learners can design one+ personalized learning pathways tailored to three learner profiles (beginner/intermediate/advanced) in a PBL (Problem-Based Learning) environment, integrate social skills evaluation criteria into a three-stage operational process (goal setting → activity structuring → performance assessment), and implement it in an actual project within a week.

Learners can propose three operational plans for a blockchain-based OER (Open Educational Resources) management system within a week, prepare a report scoring ≥70 points across technical feasibility (50%), economic viability (30%), and scalability (20%) criteria, and include an analysis of the social impact of open educational resource sharing.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
